timeline.bodyText: MQTT and AMQP messages will be sent individually - protocol library restriction?

replies.bodyText: yes, service does not support MQTT batch messages, and our current AMQP library (proton) doesn't have built in batch message capabilities so we have to implement our own. That will be done separately.

replies.bodyText: That is an excellent question. I don't think it has to necessarily be a Set, I tried to follow the other APIs we have in the internal client and used Sets. is there a drawback in using Sets here?
replies.author: azabbasi

replies.bodyText: I made it into a List to maintain the orders in the collection as Abhipsa mentioned.
replies.author: azabbasi

replies.bodyText: As long as they need to be ordered, then a List should be fine. In general, if the API can take a more generic collection type, then it should. That way users who like sets can pass in a set, and users who like lists can pass in a list. But that's all moot if we have to maintain order here.

that is the first approach I tried, If we decide to create a BulkMessage class (which I did initially) we have to expose it (which I am not a huge fan of doing).
